Applying Range Based Filters

Range based filters allow you to specify and restrict the range of numeric columns or metrics in your report. Applying Range-based Filters can only be performed after a report has been defined. Range-based Filters can be applied to reports you are currently creating in Builder or reports which you have created and saved and that are part of the Reports and Booklets page. To apply Range-based Filters in the Reports and Booklets page, select a saved report or booklet and click VIEW.

Once your report or booklet is executed, there are two ways to display data filters:

1.  Click on the ribbon icon in the top-right corner of the report panel and select ‘Data Filters’ (left image)

2.  Click on the plus (+) icon that is just below the ribbon icon (right image)

                    

 

You are then able to specify, either by using the value input boxes or by dragging the slider pins, the specific range you want to filter the numeric columns by. If you want to view a single unique numeric value, all you have to do is either input the same numeric value in both value input boxes or drag the pins till they overlap. Once you have specified a numeric range and click OK, the grid and chart are then updated. Also, “Range Filter:” will show you the ranges that you have filtered your report by, even if the actual sliders are hidden. Note that the ranges you specify are inclusive; in the following example, both $54,101,418 and $57,973,837 are included in the results set:

 

At any point in the process, you can reset all filtering by bringing about the Results Transformation dialog and clicking RESET.

It is important to keep in mind that any Range-based Filters applied to a single report or a booklet report do not persist; they are simply visual changes that are not saved and are discarded when you perform any other action or navigate away from the page.

 

Range-based Filters can also be used in the Builder page. Similar to the Reports and Booklets page, click on the ribbon icon to access the Data Filters. You are then able to use this feature as described above.
